intro: Neobartsia laniflora, commonly known as the silky bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands and marshy areas of southern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, creeping stems and dense, soft foliage covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to orange in color, which bloom during the warmer months. Neobartsia laniflora is adapted to waterlogged soils and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species in its native habitat.
